title: To All the negative votes in this board.
body:
You are probably and most likely they same overly sensitive snowflakes that are gleefully rubbing their *(ahem)* 'hands' together at the misery of others.
The same others that you reported enough out of 'offense' while getting off on them being punished.

I'm tired of seeing all the negative votes.

ANYONE for the most part that posts on THIS BOARD, CAME HERE BECAUSE THEY CARED enough....to at least question their punishment, which to me screams willingness to change.

ALL I SEE outside of some legitimate comments are down-votes.

Do you people actually want to encourage and help your community, or just dominate it from your perspective and shut out any dissent? 

MODS how about a lot more puSh for CONSTRUCTIVE CRITICISM?

Because frankly, after reading the first page of threads in this topic, all I see is a lot of hate from the community, and really zero effort on assist/reform and actual discussion. 

CLOSE THIS HEADER, or do a better job Mods. 

This forum is nothing more than a punching bag for people already DOWN. It's sick, and pointless.

replies.body:
I find it strange that you're putting a lot of emphasis on understanding the reasoning that people come here to discuss their punishments (which is fair, of course; a fair few people can be confused or need understanding of their punishment, and others still may need advice or guidance), but while you address the depth of the people coming to discuss their punishments, you only take a short glance at the downvotes and look no further.

Have you considered _why_ a fair number of threads get downvoted? By and large, it's a method for those of the community to show disagreement while not requiring that they commit that disagreement strictly to words - which could, as it were, fail them. And there are a whole host of reasons why someone could disagree with a post. Perhaps it's working off of a faulty premise, perhaps the OP isn't making an effort to understand anything and adamantly insists that they were punished wrongfully, maybe the ideas or subjects being communicated in the post are just plain _bad_.

Personally, I don't care either which way for downvotes. They're just disagreement points, and I don't think the PB board would change drastically for lack of them.

> You are probably and most likely they same overly sensitive snowflakes that are gleefully rubbing their (ahem) 'hands' together at the misery of others.
> The same others that you reported enough out of 'offense' while getting off on them being punished.

There's an adage that I've heard here and there; "Assuming makes an ass out of (yo)u and me". If the very beginning of your post starts off with a direct, underhanded insult and the assumption of bias to reinforce that insult, you're only just setting up a self-fulfilling prophecy for the sake of drama.

All those openings serve to do is insult a group of people based on their actions, _simultaneously inviting those actions_, and then take that opportunity to use those actions to reaffirm your opening insult. I'm still going to treat this as a discussion, but for future reference - and I'm gonna say this bluntly - don't pull that shit, 'kay?

> I'm tired of seeing all the negative votes.

Likewise, there are probably a few people who are tired of seeing a lot of the same things. Half-baked ideas like the removal of chat, voluntary chat restrictions, extra opportunities after the permaban, etc., posts complaining about obviously merited punishments and pointless arguments about "deserving flame" or "he started it", etc.

Perhaps it's just cynicism, but we all have to deal with seeing stuff we don't like or are tired of seeing. Perhaps your fare for such could be remedied, though - I know there was some talks amongst the Moderation team regarding removing Downvoting in _Player Behavior_ like they did for _Gameplay+_, though I've yet to have heard or seen anything of it.

> ANYONE for the most part that posts on THIS BOARD, CAME HERE BECAUSE THEY CARED enough....to at least question their punishment, which to me screams willingness to change.
>
> ALL I SEE outside of some legitimate comments are down-votes.
>
> Do you people actually want to encourage and help your community, or just dominate it from your perspective and shut out any dissent?

Again; just as people who come here to discuss matters of Player Behavior have such reasons, people who downvote have their own reasons for doing so. I don't particularly understand why you're investing so much in one fact over the other.

I've seen ample behavioral cases on the PB boards, and a fair majority of the cases, to my memory, actually lack a willingness to change on the part of the OP/punished player. It's not _uncommon_, per se, that people will want to actually change, but it's not the general majority, either.

We do want to encourage the community to flourish, but that becomes difficult when the people we're trying to help decide to _make_ it difficult. As it stands, understanding is a two-way street, and while we try our hardest to empathise and understand the punished player's situation, all of that effort goes out the window when they're not willing to give an inch themselves.

> MODS how about a lot more puSh for CONSTRUCTIVE CRITICISM?

They've been working at it, and in fact have been making pretty great strides in accomplishing some of their goals.

IIRC, the first public notice of changes being discussed by the Moderation team for the Player Behavior boards was [four months ago, by Ulanopo](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/X2n1scHx-negativity-in-pb), and then we had another similar such discussion around [a month ago](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/m4geAK5V-updated-player-behavior-guidelines), which ultimately led to the updated [Player Behavior Board Guidelines](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/OjEUxbwH-player-behavior-rules-update).

I've seen a fair amount of improvements to discussion quality since that first update, and, while of course it's not been perfect, it's still miles better than it used to be.

> Because frankly, after reading the first page of threads in this topic, all I see is a lot of hate from the community, and really zero effort on assist/reform and actual discussion.

If you see people being spiteful and/or unhelpful, report them, and the Moderation team will look into it and act accordingly.

> CLOSE THIS HEADER, or do a better job Mods.
> 
> This forum is nothing more than a punching bag for people already DOWN. It's sick, and pointless.

I mean, you're stating a lot of open distaste with the current state of _Player Behavior_, but what you should consider doing is proposing solutions that address the problem. "Do a better job" isn't helpful, especially on top of the fact that the only issue you directly address is downvoting.

So, what exactly is/are the problem(s), and how is it that you propose it get dealt with?

> [{quoted}](name=Umbral Regent,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=KolAvhxd,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-04-15T02:20:21.290+0000)
>
> I find it strange that you're putting a lot of emphasis on understanding the reasoning that people come here to discuss their punishments (which is fair, of course; a fair few people can be confused or need understanding of their punishment, and others still may need advice or guidance), but while you address the depth of the people coming to discuss their punishments, you only take a short glance at the downvotes and look no further.
> 
> Have you considered _why_ a fair number of threads get downvoted? By and large, it's a method for those of the community to show disagreement while not requiring that they commit that disagreement strictly to words - which could, as it were, fail them. And there are a whole host of reasons why someone could disagree with a post. Perhaps it's working off of a faulty premise, perhaps the OP isn't making an effort to understand anything and adamantly insists that they were punished wrongfully, maybe the ideas or subjects being communicated in the post are just plain _bad_.
> 

To be fair should people really have the ability to just hate bandwagon on a person's views without explaining why they're wrong? For example, if I were to say the world was a giant orange, and backed up my claim(I know it's a ridiculous thought, but I'm just bringing something off the top of my head), but millions of people disagreed with me, it should be up to them to disprove me, not the other way around.

It's like with other things in the world, if you say someone did something horrible, it's up to you to back up that claim, not for them to disprove it. It also to me feels like it stifles actual discussion.

> To be fair should people really have the ability to just hate bandwagon on a person's views without explaining why they're wrong?

Personally, my answer is "no". I like people getting involved in discussions and sharing their viewpoints/perspectives on various things, and I'd absolutely love to see an increase in that sort of involvement.

Objectively, I'm 50/50. Downvotes are a half-way decent way to communicate disagreement in a non-committal manner, for those who either can't put their thoughts into words well or who've had their points said by someone else, but it still doesn't really do much anything for a discussion to downvote and be done with it.

> For example, if I were to say the world was a giant orange, and backed up my claim(I know it's a ridiculous thought, but I'm just bringing something off the top of my head), but millions of people disagreed with me, it should be up to them to disprove me, not the other way around.
>
> It's like with other things in the world, if you say someone did something horrible, it's up to you to back up that claim, not for them to disprove it. It also to me feels like it stifles actual discussion.

Generally, I agree. Some part of me imagines that there could/should be _some_ middleground, but with the system we have at the moment, I think this is the closest we could get to it - and, IMO, curbing downvotes and promoting discussion involvement is pretty preferable.

Have mods discussed the option of removing votes altogether?
They have, although they said they'd probably ultimately err on removing only downvotes, but even still, the last I heard of it was four months ago.

>ANYONE for the most part that posts on THIS BOARD, CAME HERE BECAUSE THEY CARED enough....to at least question their punishment, which to me screams willingness to change.

No, it doesn't. It's a pretty common occurrence that the thread starter outright insults anyone with an opinion other than their own. Such people don't make the threads to change, they made the thread to try and get people to agree with them.
this is more the norm than the exception unfortunately

From what I've understood, you downvote to disagree with something. 
Nothing wrong with a little disapproval imo.

Well, unfortunately, low votes on threads and comments tends to hide them so in a way it's more silencing them than giving a counterargument and giving them a chance to prove their side, so in my opinion, votes on a forum are destructive to an environment where people come to voice views and opinions, as people can simply act uncivilized and shut someone up instead of providing a counterargument which is what they want.

> ANYONE for the most part that posts on THIS BOARD, CAME HERE BECAUSE THEY CARED enough....to at least question their punishment, which to me screams willingness to change.

You mean those dumb posts that usually go like "wtf y did i get banned for saying my teammate is trash? i dun get it" then treat it as if it was their first offense then you read their chat log and it usually involves them flaming for 40 mins.

> MODS how about a lot more puSh for CONSTRUCTIVE CRITICISM?

Most of the comments in those posts are usually people pointing out what specific messages might have triggered the system. The solution? Stop being a dick. Simple as that.
If you're upset about a small thing such as negative votes, maybe it's not everyone else that is the snowflake.  Just sayin.
Nobody is required to agree with anyone else on a discussion forum. If the arrows are linked to your self-esteem, it might be better to **not** post.

Yeah anyone who downvotes is sittingthere snickering rubbing their hands together like a fucking cartoon villain thinking about how much better they are than you. Or maybe youre just a dork bitching about your punishment and we dont really give a fuck. (P.s. im a better person than you)

The Mods are unhelpful sometimes. At least one I know of *cough cough* And many of the regular posters all share the same opinion on every post, no matter the verbiage used and no matter who is posting it. The poster is almost always assumed to be guilty as charged and deserving of every punishment. There is a lack of critical thinking sometimes too since most just quote farm our posts to death and respond to each section with some passive aggressive "stab" comments. :/

So I learned, from the people here, to just "stab" back. That's all that seems to happen on these boards, save for a few serious people who want to discuss or even just empathize.
